ygData.subject: Re: Hello
ygData.msgSnippet: welcome back..  You can get to level 7 in steam front killing kobolds.. then go behind the windmills to reach level 10.. at 10 if your gear is ok.. nothing
ygData.messageBody:
welcome back.. You can get to level 7 in steam front killing
kobolds.. then go behind the windmills to reach level 10.. at 10 if
your gear is ok.. nothing great... head over to kurns tower till
around 16 or 17.. then after that head over to pauladal caverns
<sp> good to level 24 at least.. after that go to the caverns
between nexus and dawn shroud peaks.<forget the name sorry> that
get you to 27 maybe 28. after that go to marus saru till 30 then
head over to split paw till 34... thats a good way to solo without
being PLed.. But if you have LDON at level 20 try to get groups in
there.. not bad loot and great exp and fun.. Hope that helps some..
good hunting...


Rickey....
56 druid
38 beast lord
32 mage
17 ranger






--- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, "W" <bamafan0971@y...> wrote:
> I have recently (taday actually) renewed my EQ fascination
> (addiction?). In my previous EQ days ( I quit right after PoP came
> out) I played strictly melee characters....had a 57th lvl Barb
> Warrior, and a 59th lvl Hum Monk. I got tired of the endless
> searching for groups, and the seeming HUGE overload of really well
> equipped melees on my server (Tunare) so this time around I
decided
> to go with a high demand class, and finally, after much
> consideration, I decided to play the class I most loved duoing
with
> as a monk, the Shaman. I rolled up a Barb Shaman with my new EQ
> Evolutions software, and -pop- there I was, back in Halas again
after
> nearly a yeas absence. A lot of things came back to me, and within
a
> couple of hours, I hit lvl 5, got my new spells, and then I hit a
> brick wall. Non of my old friends seem to be around anymore, so I
> don't have them to ask for advice, so I turned to this group for
> help. I have been told Steamfront is the best place to go to lvl
up a
> shammy for the next few cycles anyway...any thoughts on this? I am
> not looking to necessarily powerlevel, though I do miss the high
end
> raiding, pulling in Kael , the 12 hour raids in HoT in ToV, etc
and
> would like to get back to those, but I am willing to put in the
time
> to learn this classes ins and outs, and make myself an integral
part
> of any group I join. So any help with where to level, etc would be
> great, since it has been since early 2001 that I was a newbie the
> first time.........and the old haunts seem to be deserted now. I
do
> like the new transport systems, made getting out of Halas much
easier
> than it was with my warrior ( the run to Freeport with a lvl 5
> nightblind warrior in cloth armor was harrowing lol) ...also if
> anyone has a main or an alt on Tunare that would like to group
with a
> n00b shammy and help him get the hang of it all, send a tell to
> Karudore ..... see you all soon.
>
> Karudore - lvl 5 Barb n00b shammy, Tunare
> R.I.P.
> Karudor (warrior)
> Kerudor (monk)
> I miss you guys !!!!!!!!
